response.answer_text: Lord Clive or Robert Clive was the Governor of the Presidency of Fort William, Bengal between the years of 1757 and 1760. He led British troops to victory at the Battle of Plassey and aided hugely in the consolidation of British control over India. A Major-general in the British Army he fought in many battles and rose through the ranks very rapidly after joining in 1746. He would later die in southern France on the 22 November, 1774 after spending 16 years in India over the course of three terms.
